Summary: Spark shot from the moon incredibly fast and small to the naked eye
divs: Sighting DetailsLeaving to pick up my wife at on February 19th 2010 at 2:45 eastern standard time I stopped to look at the moon. I have been trying to get a good photograph of it for some time. I saw a small red spark shoot off the moon in the northerly direction from my perspective. It was red and very fast. I don't know if it was more than half a second but about that, that it traveled about 5 times the visual thickness of the moon. Then the red faded and I lost track of it. I have no description of the craft it was too far away.
trends: There have been 39 other sightings in Erie
There were no other sightings in Erie on or around February 19th 2010
